articles.title: Welcome to my space in cyberspace
articles.contents:
I am a Professor of Economics at Imperial College Business School, London (Europe). I am also associated with Growth Programme at the Centre for Economic Performance at the London School of Economics.
I am the Principal Investigator of the Productive & Inclusive Netzero Project (PRINZ, funded by the ESRC)
As of the academic year 2023/24 I am seconded to the economic research unit of the International Financial Corporation (Part of the Worldbank) to develop a research programme on climate change and sustainability.
In my research I focus on things that help to increase economic productivity without compromising the natural environment. I am also concerned about the effects and causes of online mis-information and the re-emergence of bigotism. Some of my other passions include cycling (particularly in London) and windsurfing.

Research Topics
Adoption of prosocial Technology
One pathway for transition to a clean economy is the wide spread adoption of pro social technologies; i.e. technologies with positive values for others rather than the adopter. We study the adoption of such a technology by building a virtual power plant.
Powbal
Design and evaluation of Industrial Policy
Industrial policy in the form of targeted support for specific sectors or technologies enjoys a renaissance. But which sectors exactly should be supported? I argue that governments should identify existing market failures and use industrial policy to correct these if no other tools are available. The most obvious market failure relevant to this are differences in knowledge spillovers from different technologies. I develop the idea over a number of different reports and papers including:
